title: Didot in Mac OS X...
content:
Hi guys:

I just noticed something really annoying. Open any non-adobe application- like Text Edit or Pages. Type some text with numbers set in Didot regular. Highlight it. Press command-T for the font panel then open the typography panel.

The typography panel showns some options including OSF figures but when you click on the buttom to make that happpen- NOTHING!

I thought maybe my Didot font became corrupt so I went to an Apple store to verify the OSF figures working, but then on these NEW machines they also did not work.

I checked FontBook and the Special Character utilites. I see the OSF figures there but... they don't work or I'm not allowed to access them.

I ask somebody at the help desk... the guys says that's probably an Apple corporate decision!!!

Very Annoying indeed! Its like buying a car with a radio installed that does not play the AM band even though the hardware is there.

I don't own any Adobe apps... just curious can you guys access the OSF figures in InDesign?

All my best,

Mikey
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: OSF are accessible in Glyph palette in InDesign and Illustrator
Mellel won't do it either. Illustrator and InDesign can access the old style figures via the Glyph palette only. I think there is something broken in the font.
Absolutely: I'm going through serious font issues with OSF versions with TextEdit and InDesign myself.

I suspect the Didot font (Didot.dfont) uses [AAT](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419013256/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_Advanced_Typography) tables and not OpenType tables, that's why OsF are not accessible in InDesign.

But I agree this doesn't explain why the font doesn't work correctly in TextEdit. It ought to.  
Small caps work, so I'd say the font has a bug.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419013256im_/http:/typophile.com/files/didot_macosx_4759.png)

Hello all:

Thanks guys. I thought I was the only one in the world experiencing this.

Now here is the big question: WHO DO I CONTACT/YELL TO REMEDY THE ISSUE- APPLE OR LINOTYPE???

:-) Mike Diaz
